text: Philip Michael Short (15 May 1960 – 31 August 2018) was an Irish competitive chess player, FIDE Master and five times Irish chess champion. He won the Irish Chess Championship in 1981, 1986, 1988, 2015 and 2017Irish Chess History: Irish Championship as well as the Provincial Championship of Munster in 1989, 1991 and 1993Irish Chess History: Munster Championship and the Provincial Championship of Connacht in 2013, 2014, 2016 and 2017.Irish Chess History: Connacht Championship Furthermore, he was a regular player in Irish open weekend tournaments and placed first at the Kilkenny Chess Congress in 1977, 1979 and 1980,Irish Chess History: Kilkenny at the Mulcahy Memorial in 1984, 1991 and 1993,Irish Chess History: Mulcahy Memorial and at the Cork Congress in 1994.Irish Chess History: Cork He participated with the Irish team at the 25th Chess Olympiad in 1982 and the 27th Chess Olympiad in 1986, both times on board three.OlimpBase: Short, Philip - Men's Chess Olympiads In 1990, he was awarded the title of a FIDE Master. He also played for the Douglas Chess Club in the 1993 and 1997 European Chess Club Cup.OlimpBase: Short, Philip - European Men's Chess Club Cup He was married and father of two daughters. == References == == External links == * * * 365Chess.com: Philip M Short Selected games of Philip Short Category:1960 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Irish chess players Category:Chess FIDE Masters Category:Chess Olympiad competitors
